feat.name: Ghost Hunter Dedication
entries: You have focused your training on hunting and defeating ghosts, spirits, and all manner of haunts. {@skill Lore||Pick Spirit Lore} or {@skill Lore||Haunt Lore}; you become trained in this skill. If you were already trained in both skills, you become trained in a new {@skill Lore} skill of your choice.

Choose two cantrips from the occult spell list. Each cantrip must have the divination, {@trait enchantment}, or {@trait necromancy} trait. You can cast these spells as innate occult spells. You gain access to the {@action Cast a Spell} activity if you didn't have it already.

You're trained in occult spell attack rolls and spell DCs. You can usually replace material components with somatic components, so you don't need a spell component pouch. Your key spellcasting ability for these spells is Charisma.
feat.special: You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the ghost hunter archetype.

feat.name: Ghost Strike
entries: Once per day, you can infuse a weapon you are carrying with magical energies that allow it to strike true against incorporeal undead. The weapon gains the effects of the ghost touch property rune for 10 minutes.
At 10th level, you can apply this effect to two weapons instead of one.

feat.name: Grave's Voice
entries: You can use your choice of {@skill Lore||Spirit Lore} or {@skill Lore||Haunt Lore} to {@action Make an Impression} or {@action Request} things of incorporeal creatures. At the GM's discretion, an incorporeal spirit might be willing to hear you out.

feat.name: Investigate Haunting
entries: You are skilled at noticing the telltale signs of ghosts and hauntings. Even when you aren't Investigating in exploration mode, you get a check to {@action Recall Knowledge} about incorporeal undead and haunts active in the area.
You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to skill checks to disable haunts.

feat.name: Peer Beyond
entries: You have uncanny insight into the way ghosts and haunts manifest, manipulate the mind, and rejuvenate. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against {@trait mental} effects caused by incorporeal undead and haunts, and you can roll a {@skill Lore||Spirit Lore} or {@skill Lore||Haunt Lore} check for initiative if you know that an incorporeal undead or a haunt is present.
If you are present when a spirit or haunt is defeated, you instantly gain a flash of insight into how it can be permanently put to rest.
Typically, this flash manifests as a vision that presents a quick scene closely linked to the source of the spirit or haunt's creation.

Attempt a {@skill Lore||Spirit Lore} or {@skill Lore||Haunt Lore} check, respectively, with a DC appropriate for the spirit or haunt's level. On a success, you gain a hint about how to put the spirit to rest or permanently disable the haunt; on a critical success, you learn the exact method of doing so.

feat.name: Spirit Spells
entries: Your ability to confront incorporeal menaces develops into full-fledged spellcasting. Choose a 1st-level occult spell.

You can {@action Cast a Spell||Cast this Spell} as an innate occult spell. At 6th level, you gain a 2nd-level occult spell, and at 8th level, you gain a 3rd-level occult spell. Each of these spells must have the divination, {@trait enchantment}, or {@trait necromancy} trait. You can cast each of these spells once per day.
